DataElement.preferredName: Person Receive Radiation Therapy Or Neurologic Resection Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions that address the receipt of treatment of a disease by means of radiation or neurologic excision as outlined in the study protocol in order to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Receive Radiation Therapy Or Neurologic Excision Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._To take, accept, or get something offered._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._(noor-uh-LOJ-ik) Having to do with nerves or the nervous system._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Receive Radiation Therapy Or Neurologic Excision Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: To take, accept, or get something offered.:Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:(noor-uh-LOJ-ik) Having to do with nerves or the nervous system.:The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: To take, accept, or get something offered.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Pertaining to nerves or the nervous system.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received radiatio
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received radiation therapy or neurologic resection within 1 month prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior cranial radiation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior whole brain radiation therapy or has received previous SRS/SRT within 4 weeks prior to the planned start of IPdR therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior whole brain radiation therapy?
